meanings.definition: Excessive sensitivity or responsiveness to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: Her hyperirritability made it hard for her to tolerate loud noises.
meanings.sent2: The child's hyperirritability was evident when he cried at the slightest touch.
meanings.sent3: The hyperirritability of the cat was comical as it jumped at the sight of a harmless butterfly.
meanings.sent4: His hyperirritability towards criticism was like a fragile glass easily shattered.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritability of the alarm system ensured no intruder could go unnoticed.

meanings.definition: A state of being easily irritated or provoked.
meanings.sent1: His hyperirritability often led to arguments over trivial matters.
meanings.sent2: The hyperirritability of the customer was evident when he complained about the smallest details.
meanings.sent3: The hyperirritability of the dog was amusing as it barked at its own reflection.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperirritability towards delays was like a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritability of the toddler made it challenging for the parents to keep him calm.

meanings.definition: The quality of being overly reactive or excitable.
meanings.sent1: The hyperirritability of the crowd heightened as they waited for the performer to appear.
meanings.sent2: His hyperirritability during the game showed in his quick temper and impulsive reactions.
meanings.sent3: The hyperirritability of the plant was amusing as it reacted dramatically to sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperirritability in social situations was like a spark igniting a fire of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritability of the machine caused it to malfunction under slight pressure.
